title: Fans spot 'Harry Potter reference' in clip from Beauty and the Beast
text:
F ans of Emma Watson are eagerly awaiting the release of Beauty and the Beast , the forthcoming live action remake of the Disney cartoon in which the Harry Potter stars as Belle.
In a new clip from the film released earlier this week, viewers think they've spotted a sly nod to the Harry Potter films.
The moment occurs at about the 25 second-mark in the clip below:
Meet Belle in this new clip from Disney's #BeautyAndTheBeast , in theatres in 3D March 17! üåπ Get tickets: https://t.co/OVfl7sKZVh pic.twitter.com/yaDSX5uj0H 
‚Äî Beauty and the Beast (@beourguest) February 20, 2017 S peaking to a villager named Monsieur Jean, Belle says: "Have you lost something again?"
To which he replies: "Well, I believe I have. Problem is, I can't remember what."
A number of Potter fans think this is a reference to a line spoken by Neville Longbottom in Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone , the first film in the series, during a conversation with Watson's character Hermione Granger.
In the film Neville receives a 'remembrall' in the post - a magical device to let him know if he's forgotten something. 
"The only problem is," says Neville, I can't remember what I've forgotten."
@girlposts Monsieur Jean needs a remembrall pic.twitter.com/3UkUJGXfvm 
‚Äî Jenna (@JennaKramarczyk) February 21, 2017 I t could, of course, be a total coincidence that both films feature a similar line. However, the observation prompted huge excitement on Twitter:

‚Äî broadway belara (@belaradrevm) February 21, 2017 T he new Beauty and the Beast film will use songs from the 1991 version, as well as introducing three new, previously unheard songs by that film's composer, Alan Menken (whose other credits include The Little Mermaid and Aladdin ).
